Author: Anonymous
Comment: If it is true then it is a fact, not a factoid.

Author: Pip
Comment:
I meant it like the second meaning at [http://www.cogsci.princeton.edu/cgi-bin/webwn2.0?stage=1&word=factoid](http://www.cogsci.princeton.edu/cgi-bin/webwn2.0?stage=1&word=factoid)

“a brief (usually one sentence and usually trivial) news item”

Or indeed as dictionary.com has it: “A brief, somewhat interesting fact”.

Although I accept the potential confusion, I’d never heard it used to mean anything other than what I intended. Duly noted 🙂
